sentences.en: An octopus coiled around its enemy with its tentacles.
sentences.cn: 一只章鱼用腕足卷住了敌人.

sentences.en: An octopus has a soft body and eight arms.
sentences.cn: 章鱼有着柔软的身体和八支臂.

sentences.en: And the octopus relies as much on its tentacles to get around.
sentences.cn: 章鱼依靠其触须四处游走.

sentences.en: Fishes, crabs, octopus, are part of nekton.
sentences.cn: 鱼类 、 蟹类 、 章鱼都是自游动物的组成部分.

sentences.en: He experienced nausea after eating octopus.
sentences.cn: 吃了章鱼后他感到恶心.

sentences.en: I don't like the texture of octopus.
sentences.cn: 我不喜欢咬嚼章鱼时的感觉.

sentences.en: I like octopus, but it does not seem to like me.
sentences.cn: 我喜欢吃章鱼, 但它似不宜于我的健康.

sentences.en: Other hunters, like this octopus, are also attracted to the crustacean feast.
sentences.cn: 其他捕猎者, 如这只章鱼, 也同样对这个盛宴感兴趣.

sentences.en: Other They eat other fish, crustaceans, mollusks, and octopus.
sentences.cn: 它们吃其他的鱼类 、 甲壳类 、 软体动物和章鱼.

sentences.en: Pay tender exact fare. Octopus cards are also accepted.
sentences.cn: 登车付钱,不设找赎.乘客亦可使用八达通咭缴付车资.

sentences.en: They went to the Outdoor pool and saw a big octopus.
sentences.cn: 在那之后,他们到了室外的水族池,看到了一只很大个的章鱼.

sentences.en: To her, it looked like the ink of an octopus.
sentences.cn: 对她来说, 那就像章鱼的墨汁一样.

sentences.en: What do you do when a live octopus gets stuck in your throat?
sentences.cn: 要是一只章鱼卡在你的喉咙里你会怎么办?

trans.tran_en: a sea creature with eight tentacles (= arms )
